ivardefs.name: basedOn_
ivardefs.desc: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

ivardefs.name: bodySite
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

ivardefs.name: category_
ivardefs.desc: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

ivardefs.name: code
ivardefs.desc: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

ivardefs.name: component_
ivardefs.desc: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement

ivardefs.name: dataAbsentReason
ivardefs.desc: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

ivardefs.name: derivedFrom_
ivardefs.desc: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

ivardefs.name: device
ivardefs.desc: The device used to generate the observation data.

ivardefs.name: encounter
ivardefs.desc: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

ivardefs.name: focus_
ivardefs.desc: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observa

ivardefs.name: hasMember_
ivardefs.desc: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

ivardefs.name: identifier_
ivardefs.desc: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

ivardefs.name: interpretation_
ivardefs.desc: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal.

ivardefs.name: issued
ivardefs.desc: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

ivardefs.name: method
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

ivardefs.name: note_
ivardefs.desc: Comments about the observation or the results.

ivardefs.name: partOf_
ivardefs.desc: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

ivardefs.name: performer_
ivardefs.desc: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

ivardefs.name: referenceRange_
ivardefs.desc: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.  Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR".   In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

ivardefs.name: specimen
ivardefs.desc: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

ivardefs.name: status
ivardefs.desc: The status of the result value.

ivardefs.name: subject
ivardefs.desc: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device this observation is about and into whose record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `f

properties.desc: Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.
